data.name: Dominion - Renaissance
data.detailed_description:
Renaissance is the twelfth expansion to Dominion. It includes twenty-five new Kingdom cards. There are tokens that let you save coins and actions for later, Projects that grant abilities, and Artifacts to fight over.

It’s a momentous time. Art has been revolutionized by the invention of “perspective,” and also of “funding.” A picture used to be worth a dozen or so words; these new ones are more like a hundred. Oil paintings have gotten so realistic that you’ve hired an artist to do a portrait of you each morning, so you can make sure your hair is good. Busts have gotten better too; no more stopping at the shoulders, they go all the way to the ground.

Science and medicine have advanced; there’s no more superstition, now they know the perfect number of leeches to apply for each ailment. You have a clock accurate to within an hour, and a calendar accurate to within a week. Your physician heals himself, and your barber cuts his own hair. This is truly a golden age.

Mechanics


Renaissance includes some firsts for Dominion such as a Reaction that reacts to being revealed, ways to play Actions during the Buy phase, even a way to keep playing after the game has ended.


Engines

The game is very engine friendly especially with Projects and Artifacts. Here are some of the enginey cards:

  • Acting Troupe - Village with flexibility
  • Cargo Ship - Handsize boost
  • Experiment - Inexpensive drawer
  • Hideout - Village and trasher
  • Inventor - Discounter and gainer
  • Mountain Village - Village with draw from discard
  • Priest - Trasher
  • Seer - Non terminal drawer
  • Academy - +Villagers
  • Piazza - Ongoing extra Action
  • Innovation - Speeds up Action play
  • Citadel - Ongoing doubles and Action



Big Money
Some cards push toward Big Money:

  • Spices - Versatile Treasure
  • Cathedral - Quick games
  • Pageant - Helps odd $ turns
  • Guildhall - Rewards Treasure buying


Theme

  • 15 unique card-shaped things use tokens
  • 9 things produce Coffers: Ducat, Exploration, Guildhall, Pageant, Patron, Silk Merchant, Spices, Swashbuckler, Villain
  • 8 things produce Villagers: Academy, Acting Troupe, Exploration, Lackeys, Patron, Recruiter, Sculptor, Silk Merchant
  • 1 thing uses tokens in another way: Sinister Plot
  • 4 cards get Artifacts: Border Guard, Flag Bearer, Swashbuckler, Treasurer
  • 13 things involve trashing: Acting Troupe, Cathedral, Ducat, Flag Bearer, Hideout, Improve, Old Witch, Priest, Recruiter, Research, Sewers, Silk Merchant, Treasurer

Digital Optimizations and Custom Settings
  • Old Witch - You can opt to automatically always trash a Curse
  • Pageant - You can opt to automatically spend a remaining coin on Coffers
  • Sinister Plot- You can opt to automatically add a token to Sinister Plot if it's empty
data.about_the_game:
Renaissance is the twelfth expansion to Dominion. It includes twenty-five new Kingdom cards. There are tokens that let you save coins and actions for later, Projects that grant abilities, and Artifacts to fight over.

data.short_description: Renaissance is the 12th expansion to Dominion. It includes 25 new Kingdom cards. There are tokens that let you save coins and actions for later, Projects that grant abilities, and Artifacts to fight over.
data.reviews:
“This is what I want Dominion to be. I like the Projects. Citadels - it costs eight. You can buy a province for eight! Is it worth giving up a Province to be able to double play actions for the rest of the game? Hint: Yes!”
Dice Tower

“I don't think there's any other set that has as good two cost cards... like that Border Guard. It gives you an Artifact. There's a dynamic there that you can only do with these Artifacts that get passed around.”
The Thoughtful Gamer

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7 or higher
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 2.00 GHz or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 256 MB RAM
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
